intro: Strophanthus singaporianus f. hirtellus, commonly known as the Singapore strophanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and woody stems, which are typical of the Strophanthus genus. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a fine, hairy coating. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
